title: Authors and Citation
text: Siripanich (2022). notaurin: Access Datasets 'AURIN' API. R package version 0.7.0, https://github.com/asiripanich/notaurin.
code: @Manual{,   title = {notaurin: Access Datasets from the 'AURIN' API},   author = {Amarin Siripanich},   year = {2022},   note = {R package version 0.7.0},   url = {https://github.com/asiripanich/notaurin}, }

what: Access Datasets from the AURIN API
title: Access Datasets from the AURIN API
text: üöß Warning! notaurin package affiliated AURIN way. üöß official AURIN R tutorial can found . Want know convenient way access AURIN data portal R AURIN simply doesn‚Äôt seem offer? Maybe give {notaurin} try. üò¨ goal {notaurin} provide easy way R users access 5000 OPEN DATASETS AURIN using Data Portal. can request API key : https://aurin.org.au/resources/einfrastructure/ AURIN ‚ÄúAustralia‚Äôs :kangaroo: single largest resource accessing clean, integrated, spatially enabled research-ready data issues surrounding health wellbeing, socio-economic metrics, transportation, land-use.‚Äù

title: Access Datasets from the AURIN API
text: ways can install notaurin: package requires sf package. Please see sf package‚Äôs GitHub page install non R dependencies.
code: # from CRAN for the latest version install.packages("notaurin") # from GitHub for the latest development version install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("asiripanich/notaurin")

title: Access Datasets from the AURIN API
text: First, must add AURIN API username password R environment variable .Renviron file. notaurin provides aur_register() function help step. choose set add_to_renviron = TRUE won‚Äôt need run step current machine restart R session. aur_browse() opens data catalogue AURIN default browser. Identify ‚ÄòAURIN Open API ID‚Äô field ‚ÄòAdditional Info‚Äô table dataset want download. example, public toilet 2017 dataset ‚ÄòAURIN Open API ID‚Äô field "aurin:datasource-UQ_ERG-UoM_AURIN_DB_public_toilets". Note , datasets AURIN may ‚ÄòAURIN Open API ID‚Äô, meaning downloaded via API. Alternatively, may use aur_meta search datasets without leaving R console. Use aur_get() download dataset. Let‚Äôs visualise data using ggplot2 package.  See find available datasets.
code: library(notaurin)  # add_to_renviron = TRUE, so you won't need to run this step again on current machine. aur_register(username = "your-username", password = "your-password", add_to_renviron = T) aur_browse() meta <- aur_meta() #> ‚Ñπ Creating AURIN WFS Client... #> ‚Ñπ Fetching available datasets... # print out the first five rows knitr::kable(head(meta)) # download this public toilet dataset. open_api_id <- "datasource-AU_Govt_DSS-UoM_AURIN:national_public_toilets_2017" public_toilets <- aur_get(open_api_id = open_api_id) #> ‚Ñπ Downloading 'datasource-AU_Govt_DSS-UoM_AURIN:national_public_toilets_2017'...[K‚úî Downloading 'datasource-AU_Govt_DSS-UoM_AURIN:national_public_toilets_2017'... [2.6s][K state_polygons <- aur_get(open_api_id = "datasource-AU_Govt_ABS-UoM_AURIN_DB_GeoLevel:ste_2016_aust") #> ‚Ñπ Downloading 'datasource-AU_Govt_ABS-UoM_AURIN_DB_GeoLevel:ste_2016_aust'...[K‚úî Downloading 'datasource-AU_Govt_ABS-UoM_AURIN_DB_GeoLevel:ste_2016_aust'... [6.6s][K state_polygons <- state_polygons[state_polygons$state_code_2016 %in% 1:8, ] # If you don't have the package you can install it with `install.packages("ggplot2")`. library(ggplot2) ggplot(public_toilets) +   geom_sf(data = state_polygons, fill = "antiquewhite") +   geom_sf(alpha = 0.05, aes(color = status)) +   labs(title = "Public toilets in Australia, 2017") +   scale_color_brewer(palette = "Dark2") +   theme_bw() +   guides(colour = guide_legend(override.aes = list(alpha = 1))) +   theme(panel.background = element_rect(fill = "aliceblue"))

title: Access Datasets from the AURIN API
text: many datasets need download, may want put CPUs work. code chucks show can download multiple datasets parallel using {furrr} {future} packages. First, setup workers - affects many datasets can download parallel time. maximum number workers machine can determined using future::availableCores(). Let‚Äôs assume want first 10 rows datasets AURIN word ‚Äútoilet‚Äù title. Extract AURIN open API ids download parallel.
code: library(furrr) library(future) future::plan(future::multiprocess, workers = 2) #> Warning: Strategy 'multiprocess' is deprecated in future (>= 1.20.0) [2020-10-30]. Instead, explicitly specify either 'multisession' (recommended) or 'multicore'. In the current R session, #> 'multiprocess' equals 'multicore'. knitr::kable(meta[grepl("toilet", meta$title, ignore.case = T), ]) toilet_datasets_ids <- meta$aurin_open_api_id[grepl("toilet", meta$title, ignore.case = T)] data_lst <- furrr::future_map(toilet_datasets_ids, ~ aur_get(.x, params = list(maxFeatures = 10))) #> ‚Ñπ Downloading 'datasource-AU_Govt_DSS-UoM_AURIN:national_public_toilets_2017'...[K‚úî Downloading 'datasource-AU_Govt_DSS-UoM_AURIN:national_public_toilets_2017'... [2.7s][K #> ‚Ñπ Downloading 'datasource-AU_Govt_Doh-UoM_AURIN_DB_1:national_toilet_map_2018_06'...[K‚úî Downloading 'datasource-AU_Govt_Doh-UoM_AURIN_DB_1:national_toilet_map_2018_06'... [2.7s][K #> ‚Ñπ Downloading 'datasource-UQ_ERG-UoM_AURIN_DB:public_toilets'...[K‚úî Downloading 'datasource-UQ_ERG-UoM_AURIN_DB:public_toilets'... [2s][K data_lst #> [[1]] #> Simple feature collection with 18789 features and 46 fields #> Geometry type: POINT #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: 113.4102 ymin: -43.582 xmax: 153.6263 ymax: title: Browse AURIN data catalogue. ‚Äî aur_browse
text: convenience function opens AURIN data catelogue default web browser. Use data catalogue select spatial datasets available AURIN. datasets 'AURIN Open API ID' field can downloaded current R session aur_get().

title: Fetch AURIN dataset. ‚Äî aur_get
text: Query data using WFS getFeature.

title: Fetch AURIN dataset. ‚Äî aur_get
code: aur_get(open_api_id, crs = "EPSG:4326", params = NULL)  aur_build_request(   open_api_id,   crs = "EPSG:4326",   params = NULL,   outputFormat = "application/json" )

title: Fetch AURIN dataset. ‚Äî aur_get
text: open_api_id Character. can find layer names AURIN‚Äôs datasets browsing Data Catalogue. layer name found ‚ÄòAURIN Open API ID‚Äô field dataset‚Äôs metadata. crs default "EPSG:4326". Coordinate Reference System wish use params named list contains additional parameters used constructing WFS GetFeature request. useful know ID specific feature maximum number features want query. See examples . outputFormat default "application/json", see https://docs.geoserver.org/latest/en/user/services/wfs/outputformats.html available options.

title: Fetch AURIN dataset. ‚Äî aur_get
text: sf::sf object.

title: Fetch AURIN dataset. ‚Äî aur_get
text: aur_build_request() returns URL.

title: Fetch AURIN dataset. ‚Äî aur_get
code: # follow the example in <https://aurin.org.au/resources/aurin-apis/aurin-open-api-and-r/> if (FALSE) { aur_get("aurin:datasource-UQ_ERG-UoM_AURIN_DB_public_toilets")  # Get the first 10 features. aur_get(    open_api_id,    params = list(maxFeatures = 10)  ) }

what: Get metadata of all AURIN datasets ‚Äî aur_meta
title: Get metadata of all AURIN datasets ‚Äî aur_meta
text: Get metadata AURIN datasets

title: Get metadata of all AURIN datasets ‚Äî aur_meta
Get metadata of all AURIN datasets ‚Äî aur_meta
text: force Logical. Default FALSE. Loading metadata may takes , loaded load unluss force set TRUE.

title: Get metadata of all AURIN datasets ‚Äî aur_meta
text: data.frame two columns -- aurin_open_api_id title.

title: Get metadata of all AURIN datasets ‚Äî aur_meta
code: # this may takes a while to return result. if (FALSE) { aur_meta() }

what: Create an AURIN authentication file. ‚Äî aur_register
title: Create an AURIN authentication file. ‚Äî aur_register
text: function writes AURIN API authentication R environment variable current session. add_to_renviron TRUE, write API .Renviron file AURIN_API_USERPWD.

title: Create an AURIN authentication file. ‚Äî aur_register
code: aur_register(username, password, add_to_renviron = FALSE, overwrite = FALSE)

title: Create an AURIN authentication file. ‚Äî aur_register
text: username Character. AURIN API username. password Character. AURIN API password. add_to_renviron Logical. Default FALSE. TRUE file directory authentication file added .Renviron file. overwrite Logical. Default FALSE. TRUE, existing AURIN_API_USERPWD R environment variable replaced new username password.

title: Create an AURIN authentication file. ‚Äî aur_register
Search AURIN API ‚Äî aur_search
text: Search AURIN API

title: Search AURIN API ‚Äî aur_search
text: query character.

title: Search AURIN API ‚Äî aur_search
text: data.frame two columns: aurin_open_api_id, brief_description.

text: 'AURIN' <https://aurin.org.au/resources/aurin-apis/> "Australia's single largest resource accessing clean, integrated, spatially enabled research-ready data issues surrounding health wellbeing, socio-economic metrics, transportation, land-use.". package provides functions download search datasets AURIN API (free use!).
